text: ATT&CK v18 has been released! Check out the blog post or changelog for more information. Home Techniques Enterprise Search Open Technical Databases Scan Databases Search Open Technical Databases: Scan Databases Other sub-techniques of Search Open Technical Databases (5) ID Name T1596.001 DNS/Passive DNS T1596.002 WHOIS T1596.003 Digital Certificates T1596.004 CDNs T1596.005 Scan Databases

Adversaries may search within public scan databases for information about victims that can be used during targeting. Various online services continuously publish the results of Internet scans/surveys, often harvesting information such as active IP addresses, hostnames, open ports, certificates, and even server banners.[1]

Adversaries may search scan databases to gather actionable information. Threat actors can use online resources and lookup tools to harvest information from these services. Adversaries may seek information about their already identified targets, or use these datasets to discover opportunities for successful breaches. Information from these sources may reveal opportunities for other forms of reconnaissance (ex: Active Scanning or Search Open Websites/Domains), establishing operational resources
(ex: Develop Capabilities or Obtain Capabilities), and/or initial access (ex: External Remote Services or Exploit Public-Facing Application).
ID: T1596.005 Sub-technique of: T1596 Tactic: Reconnaissance Platforms: PRE Version: 1.0 Created: 02 October 2020 Last Modified: 24 October 2025 Version Permalink Live Version Procedure Examples

ID Name Description G0096 APT41 APT41 uses the Chinese website fofa.su, similar to the Shodan scanning service, for passive scanning of victims. [2] C0040 APT41 DUST APT41 DUST used internet scan data for target development. [3] G1017 Volt Typhoon Volt Typhoon has used FOFA, Shodan, and Censys to search for exposed victim infrastructure. [4] Mitigations

ID Mitigation Description M1056 Pre-compromise This technique cannot be easily mitigated with preventive controls since it is based on behaviors performed outside of the scope of enterprise defenses and controls. Efforts should focus on minimizing the amount and sensitivity of data available to external parties. Detection Strategy

ID Name Analytic ID Analytic Description DET0858 Detection of Scan Databases AN1990 Much of this activity may have a very high occurrence and associated false positive rate, as well as potentially taking place outside the visibility of the target organization, making detection difficult for defenders. Detection efforts may be focused on related stages of the adversary lifecycle, such as during Initial Access. References Shodan. (n.d.). Shodan. Retrieved October 20, 2020.
